issues.description: The constructor in the template repository is defined with only three parameters (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents), while the problem statement requires a constructor that initializes all five attributes as shown in the UML diagram and implemented in the solution repository. This discrepancy could confuse students, as they might not know whether to modify the existing constructor signature or only implement the body, potentially leading to errors in their implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template repository's constructor in Lecture.java to include all five parameters (String lectureName, int numberOfInscribedStudents, int numberOfGuestStudents, int numberOfLecturers, int numberOfTutors) to match the problem statement and solution, ensuring students can implement the body without altering the signature.
